title: Typester
content:
I just came across this [http://typophile.com/typester](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006023929/http:/typophile.com/typester "http://typophile.com/typester")  
Very, very interesting. Will it be expanded upon in the near future?

 [‹ Monotype vs. Linotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006023929/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40147 "Go to previous forum topic") [fontlab question ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006023929/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40142 "Go to next forum topic")
author: John vanDemer

comments.content: Very cool. I can’t wait for it to be automated. And maybe prettier looking :)

Right now Typester is a bit of a proof-of-concept. We’ve got some plans to expand upon the idea, and use Flash as the main engine instead of Java. Naturally to make something like this successful, it’s got to allow any Typophile to add information.
